_comment: Created by NCODowd on 24/05/2016 16:31:58 using v2.7
title: How involved do people feel in discussing their care?
analysis_commentary: Evidence from academic research suggests that when people are involved in their own care, decisions are made more effectively and health outcomes improve. Overall, 92% of people felt decisions were made together with the NHS mental health services worker in the formal meeting to discuss how their care is working. This was an increase from 91% in 2014. 93% felt they were involved as much as they wanted to be in discussing how their care was working (data not shown).
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
